sentence: For one of his "Executive Decision" segments of Mad Money Wednesday night, Jim Cramer spoke with Marc Benioff, founder, chairman and CEO of Salesforce.com (CRM) .

Benioff was on the show to talk about the company's Work.com website, which is "an all-new suite of solutions and advisory resources to help businesses and community leaders around the world to support the health and well being of their employees."
The company is now adding a vaccine component to the website.
While that will include already available vaccines, such as for the flu, it's gearing up for the release of Covid-19 vaccines.
When the COVID-19 vaccine is released, there will likely be many of them.
We need to leverage technology to separate the "wheat from the chaff," finding out which vaccines are the best, he said.
This will be one of the largest technological and logistical challenges in the world, Benioff said.
Many companies are going to play a role in the success of a vaccine, possibly even Snowflake (SNOW) .
Salesforce is an investor in the company and Benioff explained that Salesforce continues to invest in its ecosystem where it sees opportunity.
We last looked at CRM back on August 26 and wrote that "Stay long CRM and consider raising stops to a close below $210 now from below $200.
Our next price target is $285 and then the round number of $300."
Prices stopped 50 cents short of our $285 target and pulled back in September but remained well above our stop recommendation.
Let's check on the charts of CRM again to see if we need to change our technical strategy.
In this updated daily bar chart of CRM, below, we can see that prices have been finding some support around the $240 area.
CRM is trading above the rising 50-day moving average line and well above the rising 200-day moving average line.
The On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line made a shallow decline in the first part of September but now appears to be firming again - a good sign for the bulls.
The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator has been in a take profits sell mode for much of the last month but has been narrowing towards a possible bullish upside crossover.
In this weekly bar chart of CRM, below, we see a mostly bullish picture.
Prices are in an uptrend and the gap on the daily chart (above) disappears.
CRM is trading above the rising 40-week moving average line and still looks fairly extended or overbought if you like that term better.
The OBV line shows a decline from August through September telling us that sellers became more aggressive.
The chart will improve if the OBV line turns upwards.
The MACD oscillator has narrowed in recent weeks but is still pointed up.
In this daily Point and Figure chart of CRM, below, we can see that the chart is now projecting an upside price target of $293 which is a little higher than the prior $285 target.
Bottom line strategy: Because I have a view that the broad market is more likely to correct into the year-end, I am not exactly convinced that CRM is ready to resume its rally right now.
Further sideways or even slightly lower price action could be seen in the next few weeks.
Traders should raise stop protection to $225 from a close below $210.
